issue.title: Blog Cards - Badge icon colour per category - feature request
issue.body:
Hi,
Could we have the option to style the Badge icon (in the Blog Card) so that we could set a specific colour for each category? (So a different colour icon will show depending on the Category it's in, or choose a "1st choice colour" for ones where there the post is in more than one category.
Thanks.

labels.name: component/global-widgets
labels.description: References Elementor Pro’s Global Widgets feature.

issue.body:
<!--  ## BEFORE POSTING YOUR ISSUE

- Please create GitHub issues only for bugs and feature requests. GitHub issues ARE NOT FOR SUPPORT!

- If you have questions or need general support,  Please use:  https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/elementor 

- For help and support from the Elementor community, see: https://www.facebook.com/groups/Elementors/

- To read more about Elementor, check out our documentation: https://docs.elementor.com

- Developers docs are located at https://developers.elementor.com/

===== Guidelines ====

- Search this repository (top of the page) for the issue, and make sure it has not been fixed or reported before.
- Make sure you are using the most updated versions of Elementor, WordPress & your theme.
- Deactivate all of your plugins. If this solves the problem, gradually activate your plugins one by one, until you spot the problematic plugin.
- Change your WordPress theme to WordPress TwentySixteen (or other default WordPress theme).
- If you're requesting a new feature, explain why you'd like it to be added. Try to add as much detail as you can, and be specific.

-->

## Prerequisites
<!-- MARK COMPLETED ITEMS WITH AN [x] -->

- [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor.


## Description

<!-- 
Describe which problem you've encountered. What caused the issue, and what did you expect to happen. Attach screenshots and related links to help us understand the issue in more detail. 
-->
I have a CallToAction button that I need to reproduce in several pages. It works just fine, is a simply button that throws a popup. I made it a global widget and reuse it across the website. But if I want to edit the global widget, the left sidebar of the Elementor editor becomes empty.
I have no way to edit this global widget. The rare thing is that appears to be hapening just with this global widget, I have others like a carousel that I can edit, but this one of the button, I can't.
There are some places where I use the shortcode of the button to reuse it. Don't know if this makes any difference.
If I enable safe mode, I can edit it. That makes me think that this is some compatibility issue.
![globalWidgetNoEdit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18534010/82878884-6a63c900-9f3c-11ea-94c5-8417e9cb488c.jpg)
## Steps to reproduce

<!-- 
For bug reports, list all the steps needed to reproduce your issue, so we can replicate it ourselves. 
-->
At least in my website:
- Create a pop-up
- Create a button that shows that pop-up on click
- Make the button a global widget
- Go to another page, reuse the button
- Try to edit the global widget without unlinking it

## Isolating the problem
<!-- MARK COMPLETED ITEMS WITH AN [x] -->
- [ ] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro).
- [ ] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active.
- [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

comment.body: > !!!! you can add the global widget to a page, then choose to edit the global widget there - not from saved templates Thanks, this solution worked for me. Add global widget to the page from the global menu and then the editing option is provided

issue.title: Bug: ACF group fields are not showing in the dynamic fields.

labels.name: component/dynamic-tag
labels.description: References Elementor Pro’s Dynamic Tags feature.

labels.name: component/integration/acf
labels.description: References Elementor Pro’s integration with ACF.

issue.body:
Hi there,

I am using the Elementor, Elementor PRO plugin to make using the dynamic fields from ACF. When I added custom fields to the post - Portfolio and tried to get values of them by Elementor PRO's dynamic field, I didn't get the fields fetched to the dropdown.

The following are some screenshots to the WordPress website I am using which can helps you to understand the things I tried to explain.
01) Custom Field - http://prntscr.com/pwsw9p
02) Value in the post - http://prntscr.com/pwsxse
03) Fields showing in the Elementor's dynamic value - http://prntscr.com/pwsxse

I'm working on the local environment for testing some features. Following plugins and themes, I am using on the website.

**Theme Active**
Twenty Twenty

Running with **WordPress** latest version 5.3

I hope you'll resolve this.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Thanks in advance,

issue.title: Blog Cards - Badge icon colour per category - feature request
issue.body:
Hi,
Could we have the option to style the Badge icon (in the Blog Card) so that we could set a specific colour for each category? (So a different colour icon will show depending on the Category it's in, or choose a "1st choice colour" for ones where there the post is in more than one category.
Thanks.

issue.title: Blog Cards - Badge icon colour per category - feature request
issue.body:
Hi,
Could we have the option to style the Badge icon (in the Blog Card) so that we could set a specific colour for each category? (So a different colour icon will show depending on the Category it's in, or choose a "1st choice colour" for ones where there the post is in more than one category.
Thanks.

comment.body:
> In case anyone is on the hunt for this functionality you can achieve this with a simple bit of javascript. I have two categories "Fantasy" and "Sci Fi":
> 
> `<script> document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () { var elements = document.querySelectorAll('.elementor-post__badge');
> 
> elements.forEach(function (element) { if (element.textContent === 'Fantasy') { element.style.backgroundColor = '#3c8f7c'; // Set background color for 'Fantasy' } else if (element.textContent === 'Sci Fi') { element.style.backgroundColor = '#355389'; // Set background color for 'Sci Fi' } }); }); </script>`

Wow, actually works like a charm - but there is an issue i'm having and trying to figure it out. But i'm quite inexperienced in JS.

In elementor there is an option for an infinite scrolling of posts. And when they appear - badges stay in default colors.
I'm trying to find a way to rerun a function when new elements appear but still not succeeded 😵‍💫  

If you can somehow show a way to look into it would be great. 
Thank you for your function though.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor.

### Description

When using a dynamic tag to pull in an image like the featured image there are no image size options, while without using any tags you get the option to adjust the size.

![Screenshot 2023-02-15 202136](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219145083-f565c7c6-3b09-42c8-b283-6cae7bcd3e09.png)

![Screenshot 2023-02-15 202231](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219145117-26b12580-8c91-4f48-8b63-7ef0f69ee1e7.png)


Also when you add an image to the background first to make the size options appear then decide to use a dynamic tag for an image the size option says there but is not used in final frontend image render.

See steps to reproduce section for more info.

### Steps to reproduce

**Using a dynamic tag right away doesn't present the image size option:**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219142110-cc0c5608-163e-434b-9dbb-f172fa8eadde.mp4

 
<hr>
 
**Choosing an image first then dynamic tag doesn't respect the size chosen in preview or frontend (should be thumbnail size in example):**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219142338-455bfc54-bed7-479d-8205-d55e91e190a9.mp4

- [X] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro).
- [X] This bug happens with a Blank WordPress theme active ([Hello theme](https://wordpress.org/themes/hello-elementor/)).

labels.name: component/control/group/background
labels.description: References the Background group settings control.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor.

### Description

When using a dynamic tag to pull in an image like the featured image there are no image size options, while without using any tags you get the option to adjust the size.

![Screenshot 2023-02-15 202136](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219145083-f565c7c6-3b09-42c8-b283-6cae7bcd3e09.png)

![Screenshot 2023-02-15 202231](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219145117-26b12580-8c91-4f48-8b63-7ef0f69ee1e7.png)


Also when you add an image to the background first to make the size options appear then decide to use a dynamic tag for an image the size option says there but is not used in final frontend image render.

See steps to reproduce section for more info.

### Steps to reproduce

**Using a dynamic tag right away doesn't present the image size option:**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219142110-cc0c5608-163e-434b-9dbb-f172fa8eadde.mp4

 
<hr>
 
**Choosing an image first then dynamic tag doesn't respect the size chosen in preview or frontend (should be thumbnail size in example):**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55829113/219142338-455bfc54-bed7-479d-8205-d55e91e190a9.mp4



### Isolating the problem

- [X] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro).
- [X] This bug happens with a Blank WordPress theme active ([Hello theme](https://wordpress.org/themes/hello-elementor/)).
- [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently following the steps above.

issue.title: ♿ 🐞 Bug Report: Mega Menu Accessibility is not intuitive

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates a bug with one or multiple components.

labels.name: component/nested/menu
labels.description: References the (nested) (mega) Menu (Pro) widget.

labels.name: component/nested
labels.description: References any Nested widget and components.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate. - [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor. ### Description After seeking feedback from various accessibility groups, it has become evident that the current implementation of the mega menu utilising the role="menubar" attribute lacks intuitiveness and raises several accessibility concerns. ### Issues This bug report outlines three issues: 1. **Non-intuitive Keyboard Navigation:** Keyboard users are not accustomed to navigating navigation menus solely using arrow keys. Furthermore, this behaviour is inconsistent as only top-level menu items utilise arrow keys, while links within the dropdowns use the tab key for navigation. This inconsistency can be confusing for users. 2. **Screen Reader Compatibility:** Screen readers like NVDA encounter issues with the dropdown button since it is not recognized as part of the role="menubar" specification, 3. **Missing role="menuitem" for Dropdown Links:** While the dropdown content has the appropriate role="menu" attribute, the links within the dropdown (added via nested containers) lack the necessary role="menuitem". This omission results in accessibility errors when tested with accessibility evaluation tools. ### Proposed Solution 1. Remove the role="menubar" attribute from the mega menu, and use the regular button to expand the dropdown content. 2. Consistently use the tab key for navigation throughout the menu. 3. Provide a control for each toplevel menu item to toggle between two menu structures for its dropdown content: - Simple Dropdown List Structure `
  • Dropdown Subitems
`, and - Nested Container Structure ### Steps to reproduce 1. Install the latest version of Elementor 3.16+ 2. Activate the menu feature under Elementor > Settings > Features and other necessary features 3. Add a new menu widget to a new container 4. Add some menu items and some dropdown content for each menu item 5. Use the NVDA screen reader and a keyboard to navigate through the top level menu items, once it gets to a dropdown toggle, you'll no longer be able to move to the next menu item ### Isolating the problem - [ ] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro). - [X] This bug happens with a Blank WordPress theme active ([Hello theme](https://wordpress.org/themes/hello-elementor/)). - [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently following the steps above. ### System Info

comment.body:
Great to see this reported. Here is the reported issue from axe DevTools Pro:

![image](https://github.com/elementor/elementor/assets/28606186/6b332930-989b-48b9-b610-4fde8f964c52)

issue.title: Incorrect usage of child elements when using Menu component (for megamenu) causing critical accessibility violation for screen readers

labels.name: status/awaiting_triage
labels.description: Indicates when an Issue, Pull Request, or Discussion awaits to be triaged.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor.

### Description

There is a critical accessibility violation related to the menu component in Elementor. More information about this violation can be found here: https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.8/aria-required-children?application=AxeChrome

The specific node in question is: `ul.e-n-menu-heading`

![image](https://github.com/elementor/elementor/assets/28606186/6b332930-989b-48b9-b610-4fde8f964c52)


### Steps to reproduce

This will happen whenever you insert the new Menu component and have children of the menu. 

### Isolating the problem

- [X] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro).
- [X] This bug happens with a Blank WordPress theme active ([Hello theme](https://wordpress.org/themes/hello-elementor/)).
- [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently following the steps above.

issue.title: Incorrect usage of child elements when using Menu component (for megamenu) causing critical accessibility violation for screen readers

labels.name: status/awaiting_triage
labels.description: Indicates when an Issue, Pull Request, or Discussion awaits to be triaged.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor.

### Description

There is a critical accessibility violation related to the menu component in Elementor. More information about this violation can be found here: https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.8/aria-required-children?application=AxeChrome

The specific node in question is: `ul.e-n-menu-heading`

![image](https://github.com/elementor/elementor/assets/28606186/6b332930-989b-48b9-b610-4fde8f964c52)


### Steps to reproduce

This will happen whenever you insert the new Menu component and have children of the menu. 

### Isolating the problem

- [X] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro).
- [X] This bug happens with a Blank WordPress theme active ([Hello theme](https://wordpress.org/themes/hello-elementor/)).
- [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently following the steps above.

issue.title: Popup - Close when you click on a button

labels.name: component/popup
labels.description: References any component related to Elementor Pro’s Popups feature.

issue.body:
## Prerequisites

- [x ] I have searched for similar features requests in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [x ] The feature is still missing in the latest stable version of Elementor ( Elementor Pro. )

When you build a popup with any button in it, the popup should close after clicking the button. Or there should be an option to set it like that.

Let's say you have one page website, you create a popup with a button that links to some anchor. When you click the button, the page scrolls to the anchor, but the popup is still there. This makes the popups unusable for linking to anchors, which is pretty bad.

When you click a button in a popup, the popup should go away, that's obvious. When you're linking to some other page, the popup goes away. But you forgot about people linking to anchors within the same page. 

I've found other people facing the same problem. For example here: 

https://wordpress.org/support/topic/close-elementor-popup-on-button-click/

Please give us the option to close popup on button click.

Just used maryeller's solution, thank you!

issue.title: Incorrect usage of child elements when using Menu component (for megamenu) causing critical accessibility violation for screen readers

labels.name: status/awaiting_triage
labels.description: Indicates when an Issue, Pull Request, or Discussion awaits to be triaged.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor.

### Description

There is a critical accessibility violation related to the menu component in Elementor. More information about this violation can be found here: https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.8/aria-required-children?application=AxeChrome

The specific node in question is: `ul.e-n-menu-heading`

![image](https://github.com/elementor/elementor/assets/28606186/6b332930-989b-48b9-b610-4fde8f964c52)


### Steps to reproduce

This will happen whenever you insert the new Menu component and have children of the menu. 

### Isolating the problem

- [X] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro).
- [X] This bug happens with a Blank WordPress theme active ([Hello theme](https://wordpress.org/themes/hello-elementor/)).

issue.title: 🐞 Bug report: Manual query of POSTS widget doesn't work

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates a bug with one or multiple components.

labels.name: component/posts
labels.description: References the (legacy) Posts (Pro) widget.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate.
- [X] The issue still exists against the latest stable version of Elementor.

### Description

Manual querying on `POSTS` widget doesn't work on Elementor PRO `3.7.1`.

The workaround for now is to stick with `3.6.5`.

### Steps to reproduce

**To reproduce**
1. Go to any page or template
2. Add `POSTS` widget.
3. Go to `Content`  -> `Query`
4. Select `Manual Selection` as source.
5. Inside `Search & Select` textarea select 3 names of posts. In my case these are custom post types of type `product`.
6. Select order by `Date` and order `DESC`.
7. Update and preview

**Expected result**
You should see only the posts you specified inside the query. Instead you will see all posts.

![Screenshot_304](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26840279/169320421-d67b1890-6498-4822-8eef-5e50403ac914.png) ![Screenshot_305](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26840279/169320430-e22bc0b1-c303-4b03-8f35-528ba736d420.png)

### Isolating the problem

- [X] This bug happens with only Elementor plugin active (and Elementor Pro).
- [X] This bug happens with a Blank WordPress theme active ([Hello theme](https://wordpress.org/themes/hello-elementor/)).
- [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

### System Info

N/A

comment.body:
The problem still persists.
Elementor 3.17.1
Elementor PRO 3.17.0

Additionally, the same is true in the Woocommerce Products module.

issue.title: Use the display formatting of ACF Date Field
issue.body: ## Prerequisites - [x] I have searched for similar features requests in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate. - [x] The feature is still missing in the latest stable version of Elementor ( Elementor Pro. ) **What problem is your feature request going to solve? Please describe.** I have an ACF Date field connected with a custom content type. It works fine. Now when I create a single post template I can display most things with Dynamic Field. The settings for the field are shown below. However the ACF Date when shown on the page by Elementor shows the raw value (see last image below) and not the display value of the ACF field. **Describe the solution you'd like** Allow the choice of raw or display value to be shown, or custom formatting. **Describe alternatives you've considered** Not using Elementor template for this page, but then formatting for the page will not fit in and would mean not using Elementor throughout the site or changing the layout. **Additional context** Date (ACF Field) settings Selection in Elementor editor Output

comment.body: No, it is still unsolved and this bug still needs to be re-opened

issue.title: Use the display formatting of ACF Date Field
issue.body: ## Prerequisites - [x] I have searched for similar features requests in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate. - [x] The feature is still missing in the latest stable version of Elementor ( Elementor Pro. ) **What problem is your feature request going to solve? Please describe.** I have an ACF Date field connected with a custom content type. It works fine. Now when I create a single post template I can display most things with Dynamic Field. The settings for the field are shown below. However the ACF Date when shown on the page by Elementor shows the raw value (see last image below) and not the display value of the ACF field. **Describe the solution you'd like** Allow the choice of raw or display value to be shown, or custom formatting. **Describe alternatives you've considered** Not using Elementor template for this page, but then formatting for the page will not fit in and would mean not using Elementor throughout the site or changing the layout. **Additional context** Date (ACF Field) settings Selection in Elementor editor Output

comment.body:
> t's weird because if you use Toolset and select Toolset Date, then you can format the date but if you pick ACF (there is no ACF Date on the dynamic menu), you can't format it. For example, I have events and trips on the website and I display a short version like 17 Sept on the card and Monday, 17 September on the payment page but I have had to set up 2 different field fields which is inconvenient and prone to errors (if i change one, i have to remember to change the other).
> Why is it possible with Toolset and not ACF? Strange

Same issue for me, did you solve it?
